pros: the best ever company worked for
cons: nothing but the very best

pros: Incredibly supportive work environment, and very experienced supervisors! I now have some high expectations for future supervisors/ managers.
cons: This company and work environment is too awesome to come up with any cons!

pros: Good work life balance. Great team
cons: Slow pace and pay could improve

pros: The clients are grateful for the assistance. The agency provides a much needed service.
cons: Upper management does not treat staff very well. They are more punitive than supportive when it comes to requesting changes.

pros: Good team, supportive, client care
cons: Benefits, pay, clearer policies and procedures

pros: The Experience was good overall
cons: Pay was low for job requirements

pros: Friendly, understanding, and supportive staff
cons: I was not compensated for being an LCSW since my position did not require such licensure.

pros: pass brand standard audit and best employee of the quarter
cons: health insurance and working time

job_title: CRISIS LINE WORKER in Aurora, IL
pros: They will hire anyone and it is great for those starting out to put on their resume.
cons: No meal breaks are allowed even if working 12 consecutive hours. If you are working overnight no bathroom breaks are allowed either. Management is ableist (ironic because this is mental health work) and openly talks bad about employees to other employees. Management does not care for their workers and allows callers to continuously talk to employees in threatening, derogatory, and sexually abusive ways. Management did nothing when a coworker told a dangerous client my personal information and said that the information wasn't mine and wouldn't tell me what they knew yet continued to tell my other coworkers that the dangerous caller did in fact know my personal information. Workers there also regularly break HIPPA and commit billing fraud and management covers for them.

pros: Easy going that’s about it
cons: Bad pay Do not care about employees

pros: It’s OK for a first job
cons: Upper management doesn’t know anything that is happening above. They really don’t care at all. They are secluded in there offices, gossiping and promoting their friends to upper positions. It is a bunch of white people that only cares about them. It is extremely segregated between the positions. If you’re a BIPOC person there is no chances that you’re going to get promoted one day. Burnout! People leave after six months in the job. The pay rate is so low.

pros: AID is committed to their mission
cons: communication between management could be improved

pros: The only pro is that scheduling is somewhat flexible and no matter how inept you are they will not fire you.
cons:
Managers promote based on favorites, not competency 

Pay is dismal

Overworked 

Lack of support 

Raises are paid .50 cents at a time 

Not team oriented 

Misogyny , racism, and inequality run rampant

pros: Great schedule and great teammates
cons: Low pay, no annual raises

job_title: Social Worker/Case Manager in South Elgin, IL
pros: Great coworkers, fantastic benefits package and flexible schedule. The benefits and flexibility are hard to beat. They also like to promote from within so there is tons of room for growth in the company. Fantastic company to begin with and learn what a good benefits package is like.
cons: The pay is not the best, base pay fluctuates a ton. You might have to email payroll to make sure you are getting the correct pay for your level of education and experience.

review_title: Upper Management is not in tune with their departments and more importantly their employees.
pros: Job Security, they do not like to fire people even when they should
cons: Not Paid Enough, raises done across the board not by merit

pros: Great managers that listen to yoh
cons: Not a flexible schedule. Not able to take many breaks and always having to keep track of all you time

review_title: Any ground floor plan and upper ground floor plan
pros: All is well... within short day the design is ready
cons: Well Plan design with ful security personality and accessibility,vegetation

job_title: Mental Health Professional in Aurora, IL
pros: Very little micromanaging, easy to accumulate PTO
cons: High turnover, employees become burned out within six months, work with severely mentally ill and difficult clients who those new to the field are not trained to deal with, management will not back you up if a client victimizes you

pros: Client centered, client focused, supervision for clinical license, good benefits, positive work environment, good teamwork, lots of support, 4/10hr days
cons: Challenging to find resources in the community for clients to utilize

review_title: Great place to learn and kick off your career
pros: Awesome program for DD population, Great Management, Teamwork, Positive Client Progress
cons: BH side slipping, Poor Leadership, No overtime, Burn-out and clients are suffering

review_title: Working as a Victim Services Case Manager
pros: This company offers great benefits.
cons: Pay could be better, especially for positions that are required to be on-call.

pros: The clients are fun and great to be around.
cons: Communication is worse than it should be. A lot of the time everyone is lost but still trying to do their job.

pros: Excellent place to work for
cons: Non cons everyone is super nice

pros: Pay good experience Benefits Certifications
cons: Working day program pay is less

pros: It improves knowledge and skills on doing research
cons: The work becomes challenging if the instruction provided are not clear.

review_title: Good experience in the  behavioral health population. Poor upper management, high caseload, low pay, staff burnout.
job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Aurora, IL
pros: Good mental health experience. Some staff really do care about the clients and are knowledgeable in the counseling field. Many opportunities to work with clients of different mental health diagnoses.
cons: As mentioned above. Upper management does not listen or care about direct staff workers. Seems like a very cliquey group of people in upper management who gossip and backstab. Poor hourly pay. Unreasonably high billing quota.High caseload. Low morale and high turnover among staff as a result of poor management.

pros: It is a wonderful place to begin a career in the field, as you will have a lot of exposure to many different aspects of working behavioral health.  AID's Outpatient program has wonderful staff to work with that are very supportive to one another and flexibility in hours and scheduling.  There is no micro-managing, which is also helpful.  AID also has the ability for individuals looking to obtain licensure to get weekly supervision during work hours, free of charge.
cons: Case loads are large for full-time employees (40-60 clients).  Requirements from the state and various insurance companies are every changing and always increasing.  Learning all of the responsibilities as a new staff is an often frustrating experience.  Benefits and funding have decreased over time.  Salaries are ok, but not great for the amount of work required.

pros: Flexible schedule, long term employees that really care about the individuals served.
cons:
Poor flow of communication,- right hand does not know what the left hand is doing, Upper management do not follow their own policies and procedures, inconsistency of upper management, lack of support from upper management with middle management.
As residential director there is more work than in a 24 hour day when you are working with staff and clients more staff needed in the homes to assure training and community integration.

pros: The clients are great people living with disabilities. Improving the quality of life for the clients is very rewarding. Great benefits and generous time off.
cons: Low pay, even with experience and a degree. Many coworkers do the absolute minimum forcing quality employees to do more or see the clients suffer. No repercussions for employees who slack off, do not complete work on time, or lie on paperwork and billing. Very high turnover for quality employees. Many get their six months of experience and flee.

pros: Work with disabled adults, work directly with your community. It is far more emotionally and spiritually rewarding to work here as opposed to a big box corporation. There are other benefits that can come from social services for example, a loan forgiveness program through the federal government, not to mention a tuition reimbursement program.
cons: Due to state of Illinois budget, pay rates and hours are not very good. Very difficult to have overtime.

pros: I loved working for AID. The director of nursing was amazing.  Supportive and accessible.  The RN salary was very good. I loved the residents.
cons: Can be understaffed at times. Little oversight for house staff.  Frequent staff turnover and new people created inconsistencies for house residents.

review_title: Great co workers, overloaded with work, poor working conditions
pros: The environment here is friendly and welcoming to all cultures.
cons: Billing goal is way too high, you are expected to transport clients in your personal car even when they re known to have bed bugs. Poor working conditions. The pay is very low.

pros: Awesome coworkers willing to help each other and clinical advice.  Job flexibility in some positions, able to work from home.
cons: Low pay for job requirements. Too high case loads, billing goal is too high for some positions, lack of communication between various upper management staff. Little upward mobility.

pros: Salary is decent for a non-profit, hours are flexible, managers and some directors are supportive
cons: Upper Management does not seem to care much about direct service staff, they just keep pushing to expand programs before addressing issues in their existing programs

review_title: Great mental health experience, poor management
pros: Experience in the mental health field, good for your resume and decent benefits, you will be never, ever be bored!
cons: Poor upper management, inconsistency, frequent but poor training, high billing requirements, no opportunity for overtime, wear and tear on your personal vehicle, disregard for staff safety, overall confusion in agency guidelines

pros: If you like to keep busy like I do this is a great company to work for and remain constantly active.
cons: Hand in too many pots at times.

pros: Coworkers are pretty cool.
cons: It can be very stressful at times.

review_title: Wonderful place to work but understaffed
pros: Love working with the clients. So fulfilling!
cons: Understaffed which causes stress to the staff which negatively impacts the clients

pros: They offer flexible hours and very good training
cons: The low pay is hard,  years can go between pay increases

pros: Lots of on the job experience
cons: Not a lot of time for the required paperwork

pros: Good work environment for school

pros: Always work available. Nobody ever gets fired.
